cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north through Louisiana/western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (near the Mouth of the Mississippi River/Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.under_watch: Storm Surge Watch (west of port) / None for tropical-cyclone class
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from Sabine Pass TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA and Mobile Bay AL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the MS/AL border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Hurricane warning Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River including metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (potentially major-hurricane strength) are likely at the port beginning late Sunday, with sustained winds possibly exceeding 110 mph and higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 10–15 ft possible along the Plaquemines Parish coast and up the lower Mississippi River, with large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches, producing significant flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged power outages and infrastructure damage likely.
